definition: name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Li Shutong becomes a monk and stays at the Hupao Monastery with Hongyi as his Buddhist name.
sentences.chinese: 李叔同到杭州虎跑寺出家为僧，法号弘一法师。

sentences.english: Monk of deficient is Shaolin Temple abbot, law order nocturnal emission.
sentences.chinese: 贫僧乃少林寺方丈，法号梦遗。

sentences.english: What was the monastic name of the late art educator Li Shutong?
sentences.chinese: 已故艺术教育家李叔同出家后的法号是什么？

definition: name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)/same as 法號|法号[fa3 hao4]
one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals
square zhang (i.e. unit of area 10 feet square)/monastic room 10 feet square/Buddhist or Daoist abbot/abbot's chamber
benefactor (term used by a monk to address a layperson)/donor (semiconductor)
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
to take the tonsure/to shave the head/tonsure (shaved head of Buddhist monk)
death/to pass away (of Buddhist monks, nuns etc)
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
